intro: Pseudoselago rapunculoides, commonly known as the false rapunculus, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in early spring, followed by spherical, green fruits that mature to a dark purple color. It is typically found in moist, shaded areas such as forest floors and rocky crevices. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and have a distinctive hairy texture.
